fields.description:
Cloud sites are being migrated to the new Editing experience. Having a tool that customers can use that can Identify what content on a page is compatible with the new editing experience would be extremely helpful when A cloud site is migrating to the new editor. 

This will help reduce the confusion on what content on a specific page is hindering the editor from switching from legacy to new
fields.summary: New Editor Migration tool

fields.description: We want to track the estimated date of completion of all of the tickets in our sprint with a hart indication if they were completed on time.
fields.summary: Track Estimated Date in the sprint report

fields.description:
Like lots of companies in Canada, we are forced to use Jira Server as we cannot host in the USA.

 

If you cannot do above, it would be nice to pick which region our Cloud data is hosted. As EU is an option for us, but definitely not the USA.
fields.summary: Add Canada as a Region for Jira Cloud hosting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Import/export operations are severely compromised due to an internal error, for both Jira and Confluence Cloud. Backups are also not generated.

h3. Environment

 * Jira Cloud
 * Confluence Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to generate a backup in both Jira and Confluence
 # Try to import a site backup in Jira or a Space in Confluence

h3. Expected Results

Import or export would be generated
Backup would be generated.

h3. Actual Results

An error gets displayed 

Internal error: Unable to create zip file
But don't worry, we'll fix it for you!
You just need to contact Atlassian support and paste in this error message, timestamp and your instance details.
Timestamp: 2019-10-15T13:30:17.553

Options

If you have your Network tab on your Browser, open you will see several error response codes.

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

For backups:  Backup without attachments.
fields.summary: Import and export operations are resulting in error and also Backups Not generated.

fields.description:
In a Jira ticket for DBAs, we routinely put .sql files into our tickets so we can track which fixes go with which ticket. We do not look at the code attached in the Jira attachment viewer but instead with an application on our local machine. 

It would be helpful and convenient if there was a hover button on the bottom of the attachment to download an attachment directly rather than having to open the attachment, then download it, then do back to the issue. [1 click instead of 3]
fields.summary: As a user I want to download an attachment without viewing it first

fields.description:
As example:

When a *JIRA ticket* contains  *comments* from *several* *former* employees, say former {{User A}} and {{User B}} .
Since then their names have since then been anonymized ({{Former user (inactive)}}) we cannot distinguish who wrote what. This is especially difficult in an exchange with several  questions / answers in a row involving {{User A}} and {{User B}}.A useful evolution would be to add (kind of an integer not related to the original user) or something that would help distinguish {{user A}} from {{user B}} in the exchange without being able to identify each one, like say {{Former user 836844 (inactive)}} would for instance denote {{User A}}and {{Former user 644 (inactive)}} would denote {{User B}}.
fields.summary: Add a former users distinction (like ID) to improve readability of created content

fields.description:
Atlassian is certified against the following Industry standards *SOC 2, ISO27001, PCI DSS, and CSA STAR.* Customers can download the certificates from the Atlassian [Trust center.|https://www.atlassian.com/trust/compliance]

It will be great if Atlassian products will also be *TISAX* (Trusted Information Security Assessment Exchange) compliant, this enables mutual acceptance of Information Security Assessments in the automotive industry and provides a common assessment and exchange mechanism. Assessment results always remain under the control of the assessed companies.

*More about Atlassian Security practices* on:
 [https://www.atlassian.com/trust/security/security-practices]
fields.summary: TISAX compliant

fields.description: Currently, the amount of storage used can be checked in the "Storage" menu in the site admin area, though this is product level. It would be great if users can see the break down by spaces or projects.
fields.summary: Ability to see the space/project level break down in the Storage menu

fields.description:
It would be great to have a new macro so we can caption the pictures as in the printed version of the manuals. It would make cross-referencing easier.

 

!image-2019-10-08-15-07-46-289.png!
fields.summary: Add a New Macro to Caption the Images

fields.description: When I enter an MFA code, when I insert the last of the 6 digits, the UI will automatically press 'Login', so if I made a mistake it will throw me back to the login page (username and password). It is especially annoying if I made a mistake with the last number (can't correct it).
fields.summary: Don't automatically process mfa code when last digit inserted

fields.description:
Cloud customers have the ability to stay on the latest and greatest of Atlassian’s offerings, however, the rapid pace of innovation and changes being rolled out can create change fatigue for our customers especially enterprise customers with thousands of users around the globe. Our goal is to provide administrators the ability to control the rate of change that gets released to their product instances. 

To-date, we have three tracks available:
 # *Continuous track:* products are on the continuous release track by default. They receive changes and features as soon as they become available.
 # *Preview track:* this track is only available for a sandbox environment. Products on the preview track will receive the same changes as products on the continuous track, but they receive them as a group, every two weeks.
 # *Bundled track:* products on the bundled release track will receive the same changes as products on the continuous track, but they receive them as a group, every two weeks with an additional two weeks of delay.

The bundled track and preview tracks provides admin users the control to receive changes at a regular cadence as well as the ability to preview the upcoming changes and test the new features in a sandbox respectively.

This is our first iteration of the feature and we are open to feedback. Feel free to contact me at [mtse@atlassian.com|mailto:mtse@atlassian.com] if you have any questions.
fields.summary: Control changes in Cloud - Introducing Release Tracks.

fields.description: Ability to get Business Intelligence reporting in the Cloud similar to how server customers can directly access their DB.
fields.summary: BI reporting in Cloud

fields.description: Ability to integrate security tools into Atlassian Cloud instances.
fields.summary: Integrate security tools

fields.description: *ITAR* (International Traffic in Arms Regulations) compliance for Jira and Confluence Cloud.
fields.summary: ITAR Compliance

fields.description: *HIPAA* (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996) compliance for Jira and Confluence Cloud.
fields.summary: HIPAA compliance

fields.description: When managing my user profile, many of the elements are set viewable to "Anyone", ie. Public, and there is no way to change it. The few elements that can be managed have only two possible states, "Anyone" and "Only You". Seems a bit extreme. An 'all or nothing' approach to security that is unacceptable, particularly in view of recent concerns regarding privacy. Perhaps you could *at least* one other state, "logged in users" for example. I'd be happy to help or discuss the issue further. Thank you.
fields.summary: Insufficient Profile Visibility States

fields.summary: Data Residency - Australia

fields.description: The ability to configure data locality for Jira and Confluence data stores that contain secondary data such as search indexes.
fields.summary: Data residency controls - secondary data

fields.description: The ability to configure data locally for Jira Software Cloud and Confluence Cloud data stores that contain primary data at rest - such as user content related to issues, tickets, and pages.
fields.summary: Data residency controls - primary data

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 21 May 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you all for your patience. The sandbox feature is now available to all Premium and Enterprise customers. This means that you will now have the ability to:
 # Create (an empty) sandbox
 # Delete a sandbox
 # Copy production data into your sandbox*

*There are some known caveats with what we do/do not copy. Please refer to our [official documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-sandboxes-1019402392.html].

We expect that providing fully capable sandbox environments will be a multi-step journey. Please refer to the sub-tasks for the features we're working on and/or considering. We will continue to share updates on this ticket as soon as features are available. Don't hesitate to contact me directly if you have questions at [mtse@atlassian.com|mailto:mtse@atlassian.com].

Thanks,
 Matt Tse
 Senior Product Manager, Atlassian
{panel}
h2. What is a sandbox?

A sandbox is an isolated environment where admins & developers safely test applications and extensions and preview new features without impacting the production environment.

For more about sandboxes, please check out our [official documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-sandboxes-1019402392.html].
fields.summary: Sandbox environment for Cloud (see sub-tasks for specific features)

fields.summary: REST+API+add+attribution+field+to+export+licenses
Emails not sending when users tagged in comments

fields.description:
It would be great it Atlassian Cloud will offer customers the possibility to Bring their own encryption key.
 
Bring your own encryption (BYOE)—also called bring your own key ({*}BYOK{*})—refers to a cloud computing security marketing model that purports to help cloud service customers to use their own encryption software and manage their own encryption keys.

*Update Nov 2021:* We’ve heard from many of you that BYOK (bring your own key) encryption is an important security control for those of you working with sensitive data, which is why we added it to [our cloud roadmap|https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/cloud?&search=byok] some time ago. The Early Access Program (EAP) providing BYOK encryption at rest for Jira Issue data is targeted for Q3-Q4 2022.

For more details, please refer to our [recently published article|https://www.atlassian.com/trust/privacy/byok] that provides an overview of the benefits, architecture and timelines for BYOK on Atlassian Cloud. We also [published a post in the Atlassian Community|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/BYOK-Encryption-Articles/Introducing-the-upcoming-EAP-for-BYOK-Atlassian-s-approach-and/ba-p/1853715] about a private Community group where you can ask questions, suggest ideas, and generally join the BYOK product team conversation!
fields.summary: Bring your own encryption - BYOK

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, when we wanted to remove the site admin from an instance. The *remove user* greyed out and it only shows "You don't have permission to remove this user" which doesn't really tell the customer that it's forbidden for them to remove a "site-admin". The error message was not helpful and misleading. It would be better to say "The user you are trying to remove has a site admin access. Kindly remove the user from site-admin" 

Minor details in the error message would really help our customer to get some hint on the next step to resolve the issue.

Also, it would be nice to show the product which hitting a license limit from the error message. 

Thanks
fields.summary: Improve the UI and UX flow for the user management

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, when a group is defined from the product access page. By adding a user to this group will require license for each application defined in the product access. It would be nice to show a clear error message to warn the user that the group is defined from the product access page and this would require a license when a new user is added to the group.

Also, it would be a nice to have "feature" to allow the user to still add a user to the group even it's configured from the product access page.
fields.summary: Ability to add user to a group configured in product access page when hitting license limit.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using the Permission Helper, if the email address contains an ampersand or "+"  sign it returns "user unknown" error
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Permission Helper > Enter the user's email address (abc&d@company.com)/(a+bc@company.com)
 # Enter Issue Key > Choose Permission
 # Submit

h3. Expected Results
 # Returns user's permissions

h3. Actual Results

User 'abc' is unknown
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Permission Helper Returns User Is Unknown Error

fields.description:
h3. Definition

Have a similar set of data for Cloud as we have [Space Teams Demo|https://bitbucket.org/msuntinger/teams-in-space-demo/src/master/] for Atlassian Server suite.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
It would be nice to:

- Have the sample data for Cloud products such as (Jira, Confluence, and BitBucket) new users would test the product with some sample data.
- This would show how the Atlassian Cloud suite can be integrated with each other with some sample data.

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition
When we activate a new product, an invitation is sent to all users that will gain access to the new product.

h2. Suggested Solution

h2. Why this is important
Enhance user/admin experience and avoid undesired notifications.
fields.summary: Option to disable invitation email before activating a new product

fields.description:

It's not possible to preview .wav files if using the old issue view.

Cloud

h3. Actual Results

The media player opens but the file appears as 0 seconds and cannot be played.
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-19 at 12.43.25.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Set up application link between cloud and server products, cloud has a port restriction for external application links but [Compare Atlassian cloud vs server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/compare-atlassian-cloud-vs-server-744721664.html] document doesn't specified about any ports.
 - [Link to server products from Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/link-to-server-products-from-cloud-744721656.html]
{quote}To set up application links between cloud and server products, you must have administrator permissions on both the cloud and server products. You should also make sure you meet the following requirements:
 - The product must be accessible via the ports specified in the [Compare Atlassian cloud vs server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/compare-atlassian-cloud-vs-server-744721664.html] page.{quote}

h3. Note

Related improvement issue
 - CLOUD-10521:Increase the number of possible ports which can be used in the Application Links

h3. Suggested Correction Needed

Add port restriction info to [Compare Atlassian cloud vs server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/compare-atlassian-cloud-vs-server-744721664.html] document.
{quote}Port restrictions for external application links — If you set up application links to an external application, the external application may use either an HTTP protocol (on port 80) or HTTPS protocol (on port 443) or ports 7990, 8060, 8080, 8085, 8090, 8443 (HTTP and HTTPS, standard ports for Bitbucket, Fisheye/Crucible, Bamboo, Jira and Confluence Server. Read Changing port that your Atlassian application listens on for more.)
{quote}
fields.summary: Document fix about application link between cloud and server products

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, there is no tool available for site administrators to use to check which of their site resources are open to the public periodically.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way for Administrators to check which site resources are available to the public periodically

h3. Why this is important
This as an essential feature where it is hard to have control of every user behaviour.
fields.summary: Allow Administrators to check which site resources are available publicly

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update - July 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#3572b0}
As announced at the last Atlassian Summit in April 2019, we have now expanded the global cloud footprint of the Atlassian Cloud to the following geographical regions:
 * EU (Frankfurt, Dublin - announced in May 2017)
 * APAC (Sydney, Singapore)
 * US (east, west)

New customers signing up to Jira and Confluence Cloud will be automatically provisioned into to the region closest to the customer. As usage patterns for that customer change, we will automatically move customer data to their region of best fit, to optimise overall product performance. From [this blog:|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/platform/reach-for-the-cloud]
{quote}We’ve also improved the performance of our cloud products by doubling the number of AWS regions we support around the world. We started with the US (East and West Coast) and Dublin, then quickly expanded to include Sydney and Singapore. Most recently, we launched an AWS region in Frankfurt to improve performance for our European customers. Not only does this reduce latency and improve performance for our customers in these regions, but it also will soon enable us to offer a choice of data locality for our customers.
{quote}
For more details please see:
 - [https://www.atlassian.com/blog/platform/reach-for-the-cloud]
 - [https://www.atlassian.com/trust/infrastructure]

With this update, we'll be closing this ticket as Resolved. We understand that certain customers will have more specific requests for regions not explicitly covered above, and we will track those requests under separate tickets.

Cheers
Nuwan
Atlassian Product Management{panel}

{panel:title=Status Update - June 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#3572b0}
As announced at the last Atlassian Summit, a first European data-center (located in Ireland) is now available.

You can Sign-up for our public beta offering and be one of the first customers to have their data hosted in Europe by going to: [https://www.atlassian.com/trust/infrastructure]
{quote}Atlassian cloud infrastructure expands to Europe
 Today, more than 75% of new Atlassian customers start with one of our cloud products, which means our cloud infrastructure must be up to the task. We are happy to announce that our cloud hosting infrastructure is going global, starting with the launch of a new European region in Ireland. After migration to this new infrastructure, our European cloud customers will experience improved performance and reduced latency.
 We know data privacy, security, and compliance are extremely important to our customers, and we are investing heavily in all of these areas. To reinforce this effort, we’ve made a foundational change in our cloud platform over the last year and are now using AWS to host our services. This enables us to offer an increased variety of cloud deployment regions, with strong performance and local failover options.
 But this is just a start. We’ll continue to add new cloud hosting regions around the world. If you are an existing JIRA and Confluence cloud customer and you are interested in migrating your data to Europe, you can [sign-up today|https://www.atlassian.com/trust/infrastructure].
{quote}
For more details please see:
 - [https://www.atlassian.com/blog/announcements/a-defining-moment-for-global-teamwork]
 - [https://www.atlassian.com/trust/infrastructure]
 - [http://www.computerworlduk.com/cloud-computing/atlassian-launches-first-data-centre-in-europe-as-part-of-global-expansion-3658427/]{panel}
 
h3.  Original description:

Various EU, Russia and AU customers have expressed interest in the availability of Atlassian OnDemand instances hosted outside of the US. The main issue with the US hosted services is

1) Network speed to/from locations across the pond. 
 2) Blocked content by China and Russia's national firewall

This ticket is simply to help gauge the overall interest.
fields.summary: Atlassian hosting services in Canada
Allow inserting a custom level between Epic and Story in Portfolio Hierarchy Configuration

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
When switching accounts in site admin the initial fetch is from another account on the second load from browser.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

1. Go to https://admin.stg.atlassian.com/
2. Click on any account and go to billing details page;
3. Click to Atlassian logo on the top left;
4. Click on another account and go again to billing details;
5. The loaded details will be from the first account and the second;

h3. *Expected Results*

The billing should show the billing page for the targeting instance.

h3. *Actual Results*

The billing page shows the details from the other cloud instance. 

h3. *Workaround*
 # Refresh the page to show the correct billing page.
fields.summary: When switching accounts in site admin the initial fetch is from the another account

fields.description: Would be nice to have a single login page that takes in email & password input at the same time for use alongside password managers that automatically populate (e.g. LastPass, 1Password).
fields.summary: Single Native Login Page for email & password
Remove jira project suggestion for "set up a service desk "try for free""

fields.description: Currently, site access can be set to allow users from a specific domain. This should not be allowed for public domain like gmail, Yahoo, hotmail etc. Allowing this poses a security threat to users should this be enabled for public domain unintentionally
fields.summary: Do not allow site access to public domains (gmail, Yahoo, hotmail) by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While inviting users, the option to allow users from a domain join the site is available. Checking this option, changes the site access setting to allow users from the domain join the site but this does not set the admin notification. By default, the notify admin of new users option should be checked .

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to invite users
# Enter a username
# Check the option to allow users from the domain
# Click Invite user
 !Screenshot_1128.png|thumbnail! 
# Now check the site access page


h3. Expected Results
The "NOTIFICATIONS ABOUT NEW USERS" option should be checked

h3. Actual Results
NOTIFICATIONS ABOUT NEW USERS is not checked

h3. Workaround
Add domain access directly from the site access page (not invite users page)
fields.summary: Allowing users from domain join through invite users disables alerting admin of new joiners

fields.description: User profile link in emails informing new user has joined your site redirects to the User management page. Expected behavior here would be to open the profile of the user but although username is part of the link, the general user's page is opened, and have to search for the user in the Search Field.
fields.summary: User profile link in emails informing new user has joined site redirects to User management page

fields.description: Documentation on Atlassian products is scattered across. There should be some option to have a top-down approach. Like starting from a broad topic like a project, then all artifacts of the project, like schemes, then issue types and fields and field configuration. These all items should be reachable from the broader topic's page directly.
fields.summary: Documentation Needs improvement

fields.description:
Using the pie chart on a dashboard to group all status of issues from classic and next-gen projects, causes the statuses to be grouped by identifier and not names. It should be possible to group them by name.
Since our customers can't have access to the identifier for status in next-projects, this should be a facilitator for them to see this type of data in a more user-friendly way.
fields.summary: Group issue statutes by name instead of identifier on pie chart in dashboard
Ability to link Jira Next-Gen Roadmap to Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Users cannot realize if they are using unsupported browser.

h3. Suggested Solution

Show the conservertive HTML page containing a link to https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/supported-browsers-744721663.html to unsupported browsers.

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Improve unsupported browser messages to indicate which browsers are supported

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary - Pricing popup shows $NaNt instead of real price in an app detail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h3. Expected Results
It should show a pricing quote.
h3. Actual Results
It is showing $NaNt.

h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pricing popup shows $NaNt instead of real price in an app detail

fields.description:
When the user is navigating in the *Atlassian Home* dashboard of the Cloud application (https://instance.atlassian.net/home), the same has multiple options to track activity, including Notifications, history, and feedback, for example. 

When navigating on the *Notifications* tab, it would be really useful if the user could see a list of tasks/actions assigned to the same so it would be an extra option to avoid missing such items without needing to access Confluence. This is a request to include the [tasks/actions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/add-formatting-to-your-page-724764836.html#Addformattingtoyourpage-Text] so it would help on tracking Confluence's content.
fields.summary: Include tasks/actions from Confluence to Notifications in Atlassian Home
add aop

fields.description:
Documented below is the list of Atlassian Marketplace add-on vendors who have confirmed that their add-ons are compatible with the Cloud Site Rename feature.

We’ll be updating this list as we receive more confirmations from vendors.

If you are an Ecosystem vendor, and circumstances have changed for your add-ons which results in incompatibility with the site rename feature or you would like to confirm compatibility with us, please let us know by raising a ticket [here|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/14].

AWS zone details of the cloud sites
Site export as non-site admin returns empty AAID for private users

fields.description: In the new People directory introduced in https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/work-as-a-team-in-atlassian-cloud-958446981.html, there are no ways to search users or teams using wildcards. It will great if a functionality for this would be provided.
fields.summary: Ability to search using wildcard in the new people directory
Adding Assignee to Sprint reports
Jira full page issue view - latest comment is at the top, but add new comment button is all the way at the bottom. can't read the latest comment when trying to reply to it.
Manual subscription renewal
uueuuteuu
Child Jira dependencies on the Next Gen Project Roadmap
As a user in 2019 I want the ability to choose Dark theme

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In order to use Atlassian's Cloud offerings, some organizations require an NDA to be filled out by Atlassian. At this time Atlassian has adopted a unique sales model where we do not complete, sign or provide any requested vendor forms including NDAs.

h3. Suggested Solution

Start reviewing and signing NDAs

h3. Why this is important

Organizations may have certain requirements and stipulations that require an NDA to be signed before they can utilize Atlassian's Cloud offerings. Atlassian's current policy of not signing NDAs prevent these organizations from using the Cloud products.
fields.summary: As an organization I want Atlassian to fill out an NDA before we use Atlassian Cloud

fields.description:
Deactivated users get *Your access has been revoked* message in the screen when they try to login to Cloud site.

{quote}
*Your access has been revoked*
Looks like your administrator has marked your account as inactive. Contact your administrator to solve this issue.
You can also switch accounts if you want to use a different email address.
{quote}

Users who use the tool less frequently (especially business users) do not know whom to contact.

It would be helpful if we can configure/include administrator name(s) somewhere in the screen so that the deactivated users can reach out to the admins to get the access.

 !Access Revoked.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As an administrator, I would like to include administrator details in the screen when a deactivated user tries to access Could site
Option to remove smiley suggestion when typing colon

fields.description: One of the great advantages of the cloud infrastructure is to be accessible by any location as long as the user has an internet connection. It would be useful if there was an option to limit the access to it per period of time using a configurated timezone as a reference. That way, the admins can have more control of the access to the instance out of the working hours.
fields.summary: Limit access to Jira cloud per period of time
Subtasks on roadmap in the team-managed (formerly next-gen) Project
IP Whitelisting Description in BitBucket Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

At a lower screen size, the drop-down menu selection is cut out of the screen display and it is not possible to scroll it to the top
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any page with a long drop-down menu selection in low screen size (e.g. 12')

h3. Expected Results

A scroll tab is added to the drop-down menu
h3. Actual Results

The menu selection is cut off without the scroll option

 
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Drop-down Selection Is Cut Out Of The Screen Display

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/cookies-744721661.html

"remember me" button is not shown anymore and the "seraph.rememberme.cookie" cookie seems not to be used(I see "cloud.session.token" cookie instead).
This is making the user confused, please update the doc if possible.
fields.summary: "Cookie" page is outdated, needs update
Sending a SHARE of Cloud JIRA adds PNG image attachments to the JIRA
Pipeline logs - expand environment variables like Bash set -x does
FA

As a daily Jira user and scrum master, i need the ability to create a board based off of multiple existing projects in next gen Jira so that next gen Jira can meet my bare minimum use case to justify using it and bring happiness to my life.

As a scrum master, i need the ability to create a "milestone" issue so that i can track multiple tasks and their sub-tasks under that milestone (like an epic but 1 level below) to help me track overall progress on tasks that are linked together.

Project Drop Down Search/Selection on the left menu shows 6 options and view all Why not show all options scrollable instead of going to new page I rarely notice the search box before I click 'view all projects'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Admins are receiving the following warning/error when trying to reorder the statuses of their Jira Cloud instance:

"XSRF Security Token Missing

Jira could not complete this action due to a missing form token.

You may have cleared your browser cookies, which could have resulted in the expiry of your current form token. A new form token has been reissued.

Request URL: /secure/admin/StatusDown.jspa

The original input has been captured and you can retry the operation.

Sorry, but any file attachments in the original input will be lost.
Retry Operation."

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a Jira Cloud instance, as a Jira admin;
# Access the list of statuses;
# Try to reorder a status.

h3. Expected Results

The status is reordered.

h3. Actual Results

Jira will throw a "XSRF Security Token Missing" warning/error.

h3. Workaround

Click "Retry Operation". The status should be reordered.
fields.summary: Reordering statuses gives a "XSRF Security Token Missing"

fields.description:
When using Cloud applications to install and manage third-party apps, add-ons that have an update available will request manual interaction from the users in order to do the operation. While this is useful for situations to avoid automatically paid add-ons to happen, it might affect on the usability of the user if the available update for the add-on introduces a bug fixing for a previous version. This would make the user to manually need to check it with some frequency.

This is a suggestion to allow specific apps to have automatic updates configured by the administrators through the UPM.
fields.summary: Automatic update for specific apps
